Rule.Name: Presenters should have correct suffix
Rule.Description: All presenter implementations should have their type name suffixed with the word 'Presenter'. For example, 'LoginPresenter'.
Rule.Resolution: The name of type {0} does not end with the suffix 'Presenter'. Add the suffix to the type name.

Rule.Name: Presenters should have descriptive names
Rule.Description: All presenter implementations should have a type name that describes their function. For example, 'LoginPresenter'.
Rule.Resolution: The name of type {0} does not describe the presenter's function. Use a more descriptive name.

Rule.Name: Presenters should use provided base implementation
Rule.Description: All presenters should inherit from WebFormsMvp.Presenter<TView>. They should not implement WebFormsMvp.IPresenter or WebFormsMvp.IPresenter<TView> directly.
Rule.Resolution: {0} does not inherit from WebFormsMvp.Presenter<TView>. Instead, it implements WebFormsMvp.IPresenter or WebFormsMvp.IPresenter<TView> directly. Change the type to inherit from WebFormsMvp.Presenter<TView>.

Rule.Name: Presenters should use consistent view type
Rule.Description: Presenter constructors should accept the same view type as the one specified as the presenter's generic type argument. For example, a presenter that implements WebFormsMvp.IPresenter<MyApp.IMyCustomView> should only expose MyApp.IMyCustomView on the constructor.
Rule.Resolution: {0} implements WebFormsMvp.IPresenter<{1}> however the constructor expects a view of type {2}. Make the types consistent by updating the constructor to accept {1} or change the presenter's type definition to use {2}.

Rule.Name: Presenters should not replace View.Model
Rule.Description: Presenter code should never set the View.Model property. The framework automatically intitializes this property to its default value when the presenter is constructed. (The property setter is only public due to requirements imposed by medium trust environments.) Change your presenter code to set propeties within the model instead.
Rule.Resolution: Change your presenter code to set propeties within the model instead.
